utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Hi, this is %uh tour guide %uh one my name is Lynnette and can I get your name?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: and I'm planning %um a tour in Singapore for maybe %um a day or two but probably %um- it's maybe a couple of days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So can I say about three days?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Hm, I think %um, yah maybe maximum of three days.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And Melissa, %uh when would you be- %uh which period of time are you coming in?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think that would be on %um first week of April.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: First week of April, that's pretty soon, %uh?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah because %uh that would be %um a holiday here in our country so it would give me time to you know relax also from work.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So Melissa %um in order for me to help you to plan your stay in Singapore %uh would you be able to give me some details like how many %uh like who will you be coming with and you know, is there any special thing that you'd like to do here?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well I think I'll be bringing %um a couple of my friends.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think my two best friends are also interested to come in with me.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um we like to, you know- we are very %um- we three are %um we like to eat so we would like to explore the cuisine, Singaporean cuisine and also %um see %um beautiful spots there and also where we could %um shop and also relax.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you think %um three days would suffice for us to do all that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Also one of my friend %um she likes to do, you know %um something extreme like %uh she likes wall climbing and do para~ %um Zip lining.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the- well of course if you can spare five times that would be great but %uh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I mean three days I could- we could still do everything that %uh you would like to do and %uh I guess your friends the age one would be about twenty to thirty?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh your budget will be in a range of a thousand dollars?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um I think %uh we would add- would that be in Singaporean or in Peso- in US dollars?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I'm not really very %um particular with the exchange rate yet %uh but I- %um individually I think our price range budget would be from thirty five to forty five thousand each.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Pesos, so I think that would be-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- okay, everything that I quoted here will be in the region of a thousand dollars so that means three person will be three thousand Singapore dollars?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh because right now- okay, we'll- first of all we will be doing all the things the local people do because you are still young right,

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: so you can take the subway to- from the airport to your hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so what I will suggest is the subway is located on the Eastern part of Singapore in the area called Changi and you can take the East-West line.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um from the airport to %uh- if we take the subway we can see the %um city the scenery of Singapore already, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, because I'm opening up  %uh the subway map for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see the map now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, can you see the number three.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: East. %Oh this is the Eastern part of Singapore, okay.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: East. %Oh this is the Eastern part of Singapore, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, so you'll see a few colours right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So the green line will be the East-West line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So can you see number two on your left hand side?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's from the- it's it's in the other part.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm just giving you the green line that is from the East to the West.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, and the red line will be the North.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: The red one so that's the North?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, can you see like %uh Woodlands that's in the North, okay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see the top-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then down will be number ten, can you see number ten?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Southwest %uh South- towards the South, number ten.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Um can you bring it down a little more.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, I can see number ten already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we have the purple line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh this is our latest line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So this is the map of our subway.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's fairly easy to get around %uh our %uh sub- by using the subway and you will save like quite a lot of money instead of taking the taxis.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course you can always do some sight-seeing while you're taking the subway, right because %uh away from the centre part of the- of Singapore the trains will be running above ground.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you actually get to view %uh you know the- some parts %uh of the island %uh and you know if you feel like stopping you can always stop.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh so %um this %um coloured square these are %um substation, right that we can always stop if we wanted to?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That's where you ha~ Yes, correct.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay so I will close this map so you have an idea right, how the subway trains run.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so what I will suggest is %uh when you arrive Singapore you can get a map of the subway trains and it's just like any other country in the world.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh let's say you are from Changi and you want to go to Paya Lebar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Can you see the junction of the yellow and green line?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so let say you're going there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do is you go to the train station and you will press Paya Lebar and the machine will tell you how much is the cost.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so you just put in the Singapore money accordingly.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again I'll suggest that you change some %uh Singapore money at the airport.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There's a money changer inside, before you come out, before you collect your bags there's a money changer there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And when you just come out from  %uh the transit area from the airport %uh there are also money changer just immediately outside the %uh %uh the airport area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you change some money first in order for you to take the subway to get to your hotel, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So try to get some smaller notes like two dollars and five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if from Changi Airport %uh until Paya Lebar-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, %uh how much would it cost in the subway train?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, if you are taking the %um uh- if you are using because you- I think you will be spending a few days so what you can do is you can a buy a %uh- you can buy this %uh a tourist card.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That's the one you're gonna use- %um that card you will be using when you're going to ride in the LRT, right so that %uh you won't be buying- %um purchasing tickets when going in and out of the train?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because %uh our standard card, let's say if the price is a dollar you have to put in two dollars because there is a one dollar deposit and when you leave the station you have to get back your deposit.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So there's a deposit when you ride the train okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you must remember to get back your deposit after you exit from the %uh the barrier, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So like I said since you're spending a few days you can buy the %uh the tourist card or you can buy this stored value card as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So of course there is also %uh %uh a deposit that's %uh given to the stored value card.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so because we also have like %uh different timing let's say %uh morning off-peak hours there are certain and it's slightly cheaper.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So only way to save to- you save quite a lot travelling on the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we call our subway the MRT.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just like here we call it also MRT.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so no issue %uh. So every- all the information are given in English %uh so it's no problem for you if you're coming from Philippines.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So and if you need any help just feel free to approach our station %uh our customer service is open.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know the MRT %uh train station there's always %uh office, you know you can approach them for help.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we have to buy these cards in MRT in the morning so that they're much cheaper.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um these cards they have different prices within the day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no we just have the morning %uh off-peak hours but the rest of the day is the same price.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so now once you let say from the hotel- %uh do you have any hotel in mind that you want to stay?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So do you think you can suggest some where we could stay?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are quite a number of %uh hotels that you can stay %uh the- I guess you don't really mind like %uh budget hotels?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Bencoolen, it's near to City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And since it's near in the City Hall so that i~

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: do you have also %um like %uh museums there near-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is like %uh Bencoolen Hotel, Bayview Hotel, it's just in City Hall so it's fairly convenient for you.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do is you take the train, %uh of course you have to get off at expo- %uh Tanah Merah and then you change to the next train to get down to the- %uh you use back the green line, the East-West line, you alight at City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there it's just about seven to ten minutes' walk to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: okay, so around your hotel there are lot of things to do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you can try some %uh local food there as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah we would like to do that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh okay I'm just opening up the Bayview Hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just %uh five minutes I would say Bras Basah to Dhoby Ghaut Station

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you just- even if you don't want to change station you can actually do a short walk from the city.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think walking would be much better because you know while walking we can look around to see the-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh from the City Hall it's just about ten minutes I would say to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um of course these are like I would say city hotel so the rooms are not that big.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But I guess you'll be out of the whole day, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So just go back and sleep, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So okay, and out there we have very nice %uh %uh museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just across from your hotel you can spend easily, you know two hours, I would say minimum one hour in the museum.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %um what can we expect to see in the museum?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, we have a gallery %uh the history of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's at the back part which is also the newest part of the museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can do- you get a good overview of Singapore history from the early- %uh %uh before Raffles time right through %uh modern Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So just to do that gallery you need minimum forty five minutes.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's forty five minutes for that single gallery alone?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah because it's quite a big gallery and it's very %uh I would say it's very well planned so you will get a very good overview of Singapore history.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, if you- Yah, and if you have time you can do- we have living galleries %uh on the second level.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so yah %uh- I would say then you go to- if you have time alright our food gallery.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh well that will give you an introduction to some of our local food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, so you can do that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if your other friends or yourself would like to do some art %uh pieces we have a very good museum just across from the National Museum it's called SAM, S A M.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, it's- we don't call it Sa~ %uh yah you can call it SAM.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's actually in full it stands for the Singapore Arts Museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can tour another hour out there okay and this museum used to be located in an old school called Saint Joseph Institution.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the museums that's taken care of, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course if you like some relaxation they have %uh sauna and fitness centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, in the hotel itself so you can do that.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh, so they have that already in the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, they have a sauna and a fitness centre.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And again, you know if you don't want to have breakfast in your hotel just outside your hotel there is an air-conditioned food court.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's where we can try, you know the authentic Singaporean cuisine?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's air-conditioned so you have various kind of food like %uh from Chinese, Malay, Indian %uh even Philippines food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: That is all found in this food court.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You know if you miss %uh food there is one store there as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So- but of course you want to try some local food so I'll guess that

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And one of our local food that %uh a lot of the local likes to do in the morning is we have what we called the kaya toast with coffee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh we have this bread with two %uh soft boiled %uh egg.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright and %um at the bread we will put some kaya which is made of egg, it's like egg custard.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and- yes you can have your coffee.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's a very local breakfast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's what the local people do for breakfast.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can go over to do your museums.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I would definitely also recommend going to Sentosa Island.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you saw the Bayview Hotel already on the screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright so we can go to Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's an island of the Southern part of Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay and then I think you like %uh swimming as well, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do like a morning %uh swim.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And since your friend like %uh adventure we have the adventure park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh you have also adventure park, that's good.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so this is something that you saw on the screen.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Well you can spend like %uh two hours there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: We have the parajump, jungle trip, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay the prices are all %uh stated there, parajump is like per jump is fifteen dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: All the prices I'm going to quote you will be in Singapore dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: These are something that your friend would be keen to do.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah, I think she'll be interested with the parajump she likes heights.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then we have the ClimbMax as well it's an aerial %uh obstacle.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, you saw that on the screen now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh this ClimbMax is this one with the ropes?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think your friend will enjoy all these.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I think she will get to enjoy herself %um and let say if you or some of your other friends are not interested you can do- so you can separate.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can- some of them wants to do the adventure go to the adventure the rest were not so adventurous can do sunbathing or just have a swim in our lagoon.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, so you can do the beaches.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you- so in their beaches also do you have %um like %um scuba?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Do you- do they al also offer scuba diving like that %uh snorkelling?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No. But in other parts you have?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh you also have a- what's this, this Universal-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we have %uh Universal Studio as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah this is- you saw Universal Studio now on the screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh so I will suggest like a whole day trip on Sentosa.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So like your friends want to go adventure park they can do that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You will spend about one hour, one and a half hours to two hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you go over to Universal Park.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can see- %uh you can do this- so you'll probably spend about another half day on %uh Universal Park.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: is this where this %um dolphin show is?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's not open yet the dolphin thing %uh but the Uni~ %uh right now if you want to see the dolphin show it's in another attraction but on Sentosa itself.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright, and that would be at the Underwater World.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So what you do in the Underwater World you go inside, it's located like %uh below the ground area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can go on this travel later that takes you around the whole underwater tank.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they also have a dolphin show out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So okay you saw the Universal now on this screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can buy like a day pass.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's cost an adult sixty eight dollars a day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And that would be like %uh weekday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, for weekend it will be about seventy two dollars.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh that's Universal Studio, of course lots of things to do there, all the interesting ride like %uh Madagascar and they have this Transformer ride I think that's thrilling as well.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh %um we have to spend like %um the whole day in Sentosa for that right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would say  to four hours minimum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Because if you want to do some of the rides, you know and the show.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that's something you can do and let's say in the evening-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Evening you can do %uh- we have actually another show it's called Song of the Sea.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's like a play, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's water and laser and fire show.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yah I've seen one here also that's very beautiful by the way.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do that you know

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %uh and then maybe you can have a late dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Let's say you see the show at seven thirty, seven forty and then you come out.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You take the %uh Sentosa express it's a train on Sentosa and you can have your dinner over at VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: When you come out of the island it's on the South, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's just about %uh one KM away there's this big wave like shopping centre called VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's- so it's like a mall?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, it's a shopping mall there are lots of restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay and if you don't like %uh you can go over to Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Clarke, C L A R K E next word is Q U A Y.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again there are lot restaurants out there %uh and you can have your meal by the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah and you can have drinks.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright after your dinner you can have drinks there it is a very popular %uh area for both Singaporeans and tourists.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think it %uh- the view there is much better at night than at day time?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh of course it's not as hot and %uh people come out to play so it's nice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But day time is also alright because at day it will be a little bit quieter

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there's a lot of %uh people out in Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's not that crowded as in you know it's so crowded, I mean it's just %uh nice crowd out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's much- it's a place where we can relax after the day, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, you can just go and have drinks and some of the restaurants are in fact in Singapore we don't dress up I would say we dress down.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So it's alright if we were just in our usual clothes not really-

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah you don't really need to %uh dress up.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So I'm actually clipping for you the %uh Clarke Quay area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah you saw the restaurants by the bay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are different %uh %uh restaurants out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay there are so many outlets out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There you can see now %uh the shape of Clarke Quay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay the blue part can you see the blue part?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Blue part, yah this is water?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, that is the- Yes, that's the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can have your meals- you see all these red, purple all these are restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay all these are restaurants here block D, block E, block A, they are all restaurants out there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think it's nice to have a meal on one of that restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course you must always try our signature- Singapore signature's food right?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what can you suggest that %um we should try?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can have our signature chili crab, pepper crab in the seafood restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah so do try that and of course with some other dishes %uh the other restaurant's recommendation but don't forget to try our signature food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So %uh most of %um more- %uh most of the Singaporean cuisines are seafoods, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh no, we have a lot of other food as well it's just that I think a lot of people %uh know about the %uh chili crabs and pepper crabs because we- %uh the local love this food very much.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And our- And some of our other local food will be like %um %uh fried Hokkien Noodles

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh if you like %uh we have fried kway teow as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay %uh otah, things like this okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And April- okay April we still do have- have you ever tried the durian?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: No. Durian, yah we also have that here in the Southern part.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So then I think %uh we will just %uh-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Bu~ But you have that also, the durian?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah the local people like eat- to eat this fruit very much.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: But it's really- it taste good but it's just the smell.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I think you can just try our chili crabs and pepper crab and it's fine to eat with your hands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Even if you are in a restaurant it's fine you can just use your hands to eat them.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we eat with our hands in the restaurants.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And all the restaurants if you order this dish they always give you a bowl with water and lime or lemon in the water, that's not for drinking it's for you to wash your hands.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: We might take it as a juice.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah just to warn you first, you know that's not for drinking.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Well yes, thank you for warning me.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can try- you can do that as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then the first day maybe do it, take it easier, you do a little bit of museum do a bit of shopping around your hotel area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh there's a shopping mall called City Hall.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, in City Hall there is shopping centre called Raffles City.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Raffles, R A F F L E S.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there all the shopping outlets there including mid-range to local brands to %uh the luxury brands.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and if you are still not tired you can go over to the underground shopping mall called CityLink.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I think- %Oh from City Hall also.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: It's also near from City Hall?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's just %uh inside in the basement area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And from there you can walk to another shopping area called Marina Square.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Yes, so what can we- %uh what can we expect to see the Marina Square?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Is it much cheaper in the Raffles City?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I would say some of them have different %uh outlets out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you can also from %uh your hotel area you go over to our very famous shopping street called Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah from Dhoby Ghaut or Bras Basah, okay.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and you go to this shopping street called Orchard Road, it's just about three stop away from your %uh hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So every other building will be either a shopping mall or a hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do a bit of shopping and also you can have your meals out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again all the shopping mall will have a food court.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Okay so that they- we won't go far more from %um the shopping mall.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So if we get tired we can already eat there, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes or you can have a coffee or tea %uh in a café in Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, I'm just clicking out %uh Orchard Road now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay, can you see %uh just a picture there on the right hand side?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And- %ah it's just like a street then there are %uh ma~ %um stalls already there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Every other building on the street will be either a shopping mall or a hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again you have luxury brand to %uh mid-range to local brands and it's also fun to just do people watching out there on Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again you just can dress casual.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So aside from %um shopping %um what else can we do here in Orchard Road?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can do like people watching, a bit of shopping, you can do your coffee, tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh spend about- again yo~ again they all depends, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: How much shopping do you want to do %uh let say about two hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay then you do your %uh museum.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I think maybe the first day you go for your chili crab at Clarke Quay that would be better.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So like first day a little bit of walking around %uh and again if you want to do some %uh- yah I think that would be cover some of your first day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Second day set off early- early, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you go for your breakfast a little bit of swim your friend can do all the adventure thing.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So second %uh- %um so %um will you suggest that %uh we do Sentosa Island on the second day?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: I will suggest that you do that on the second day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh do a bit of %uh the swim, the adventure park, afternoon you can go for your %uh Universal Studio.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It close at seven so you can stay till seven and then come out have your dinner.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can try a different cuisine now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh first day you can do your chili crab second days, I think most Filipino's like spicy food right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have- you can try some Indian food, Malay food.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Indian, %oh. You also have %uh Indian- you also have a lot of Indian foods there?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, we- all our food court we have Indian food.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Of course there are also restaurants there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you can do- because if you're coming out by seven o'clock then you can come out and have dinner at VivoCity.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and I guess by then you will finish about nine thirty, ten o'clock then you can proceed home- %uh proceed back to the hotel.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And third day I would suggest that you go up to our- one of our %uh residential area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you go to an area which is not too far away that is the North line.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can go to this area called Toa Payoh

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And next word will be Payoh.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what can we expect to see here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh you can visit our- just walk around %uh- okay, you just walk around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's quite interesting because you're right in the heart of our residential area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %uh so we can see %um how the day to day of an ordinary Singaporean resident is?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes. So you take the subway again from this.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes. So you take the subway again from this.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And %uh you see how every day how we live.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And what you can do is we have a gallery in this building in Toa Payoh called HDB Gallery.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay. Can you see now on the screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay. Can you see now on the screen?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it showcase, you can spend about twenty minutes in there just to have an idea of how our public housing is like.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Hm right from the early days in the nineteen sixties %uh to now.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we can see %um how the Singaporean housing have evolved through the years?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah. So %uh that's something you can do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah. So %uh that's something you can do.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Alright. So you just need- it's a small gallery about twenty minutes is sufficient.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And then you can go to a local food centre because there were a lot of little %uh food centres in Toa Payoh, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just go to the one that's fairly crowded.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: If you don't know what to order, just look at what people are eating and just ask them which store they order from.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so you'll get to well %uh interact with our local so it becomes a little bit more interesting.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And- so you can do that for half day.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh and I guess afternoon you may want to do some spa?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can do your %uh- again we do have spas around your hotel area, there are quite a few spas located there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In all the shopping centre there'll be a spa there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So aside  from the one at the hotel %uh there are also lot of spas %um near the hotel?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: There are also quite a few so you can do that and I think that will cover your second day already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And I would say the third day you can visit the Botanical Gardens.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: That- yah we'll love to see that.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is located just off %uh Orchard Road.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can easily spend about two hours.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay you can see now the Botanical Gardens?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So we got see %um different species of plants here that are endemic in Singapore only or do you have also plants from other countries?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: No we do have but %uh actually the highlight of the botanical gardens would be %uh the orchids.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh O R C H I D S, orchids.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that is actually  %uh the highlight of this %uh garden.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: See- can you see National Orchid Garden?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Also you have %um a lot- different species of orchids here?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And it's so beautiful out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And they open early as early as eight thirty in the morning to seven.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So admission for one adult is five dollars.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh I think we're gonna get a lot of pictures here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes because every other spot is a picture spot.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So try to do that in the morning when it's not so hot.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So aside from the orchids %um are there any more plants that are showcased?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Like you know %um plants that are just %um endemic for- in Singapore like plants that are just found %um in Singapore.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Some of the orchids are cultivated here %uh but of course we export our orchids.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: In fact Singapore is the world third %uh largest exporter of orchids.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So we have like plants- %uh orchids plants that are specially cultivated here.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And we get to see that, yah.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes, in the National Orchid Garden in the Singapore Botanic Gardens.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you are let's say planning a trip there on a Sunday we normally have some free %uh shows in the garden in the evening at six o'clock.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So what do they do in these shows?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It all depends %uh we have it %uh once a month in the- just outside the National Orchid Garden there is like a slope.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It can be a jazz concert, it can be %uh %uh quintet, it can be singing, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it all depends on what is available, what is %uh planned for that particular Sunday.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can always pack your picnic basket with wine and just sit and with your mat, alright.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Just sleep or sit over there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So that would be the evening time already.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay then sa~ let's say if you are doing the morning garden, alright?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Then you can have your lunch again, you know anywhere you like either in Orchard Road and you can plan a trip to Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yes because %uh you know traditionally we do have ethnic area in Singapore so we have like %uh Chinatown, Little India and Kampong Glam.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So again you can take the subway to go there.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: And then we just- %um from the subway we just %um walk to Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh it's actually we have a station called Chinatown station.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Otherwise the closest East-West line would be the Tanjong Pagar.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And you can walk about ten minutes' walk.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Or you can visit one of our oldest Chinese temple called Th~

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, called Thian Hock Keng Temple.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's a Buddhist temple, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh yes it's a Buddhist, Taoist and Confucianism.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So can you see now the picture of Chinatown?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh yah, I can see it now.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, so you can see this cup of coffee just now?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So the- So there are %um- we can see %um- %um we can go shopping here also and dine?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So this is an old building, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, these are all old building which has been restored.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in the old days where the people from all over the world when they came to Singapore they like to live in this area which is near the Singapore River.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Um and eventually it gets very crowded so people move away from this area and it became just the Chinese area.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: People ca~ %uh a lot of Chinese live here because they work-

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: so only the Chinese were left in this area that's why it's called Chinatown now?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh I would say there are minority races who live here but majority who were left here were the Chinese, they live here.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So in the old days they live on the second floor or third floor, ground floor was used a shop but today we used the ground floor as shops.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Second and third level %uh we mainly used them as either a store room or %uh office.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's quite nice to walk around.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: I noticed that %um the buildings they have %um huge windows?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Okay this- because in the past there were no air-condition %uh so they- the architects I would say are pretty %uh creative, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: They make the big windows which is actually- well we learned from %uh the Europeans, alright, %uh to have big windows.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: %Oh so- So these big windows are European influences, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah, they are influences %uh from Europe and when- you see in the past when you open up fully you can get more ventilation into the house.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And right in the centre there's actually an air well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Air well that means it's an open space that goes up to the top of the building and it's not covered.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So that's like the ventilation so that- %uh the ventilation of the air so that it's too hot inside.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh %uh the front is narrow but it's pretty long so they need to have some ventilation as well as light coming into the house.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: %Uh so these are the China Town houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And if you go to China Town do look out for this green colour roof that looks like bamboo.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah because %uh according to the Chinese the bamboos represents %uh long life.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So these are the %uh peculiar %uh features of the Chinatown houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And also do look out for outside the houses there are engravings like phoenixes, flowers %uh on the outside of the houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: But it's just above the green roof on the first level there are usually some engravings out there.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's nice to walk around.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can go for foot massage over in Chinatown.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: You can have a Chinese tea appreciation in Chinatown as well.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So do spend about one hour if you plan to have your Chinese tea appreciation

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: with some %uh so-called small bites you know like titbits kind of %uh thing.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So there are few like %uh Chinese tea appreciation %uh places in Chinatown itself.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So they also have that like %um- do they also perform like %um tea ceremony like that?

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: Just like, you know in Japan, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Our tea appreciation is not as elaborate as the Japanese %uh but our tea if you are going to have your tea in the Chinese %uh tea houses the tea comes in- they are being served in small little cups.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So %uh the owners or the server would be able to assist you as to how we drink or appreciate this Chinese tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah because you have to go a few rounds.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: The first round is to warm up the cups %uh then the first cup where you take is %uh for you to smell the tea and later on you drink this tea.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you sip, you don't drink the whole cup.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: It's all very little cups, you know it's like %uh what the cups would look like the kind of %uh toys when we are small we used to play with this little cups, it looks that small.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So they- the cups used are just very small?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: Yah it is a small cup so it's actually appreciation.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So you smell it first and then you sip slowly and meanwhile, you know you sort of %uh chit chat with your friends.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: So it's very relaxing %uh in this kind of tea houses.

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course at the same time you can order some small %uh %uh bites alright but of course it will be more Chinese related kind of %uh food like snacks.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So I think %um that would be the last itinerary, right?

utterances.speaker: Guide
utterances.transcript: And of course if you can go to the airport early you can always do shopping out in the airport, your last minute shopping because there's so many shops in the airport even in the transit area.

utterances.speaker: Tourist
utterances.transcript: So okay thank you so much for helping me out %um plan my %um stay there in Singapore.
